title: Apollo 204 (later renamed Apollo 1)crewmembers Grissom, White & Chaffee lost their lives in a fire at Pad 34

gallery.description: Three Apollo astronauts participate in crew equipment critical design review activity inside Apollo mockup no.2 at North American?s mockup display area at the Downey facility

Astronauts for NASA's Apollo missions Virgil I. Grissom, command pilot for the first Apollo mission, R. Walter Cunningham and Russell L. Schweickart, backup navigators for the first Apollo mission are undergoing tests at the McDonnell Aircraft plant.
Three NASA Apollo astronauts participate in crew equipment stowage Critical Design Review activity. (L-r) Astronauts Virgil I. Grissom, Russell L. Schweickart, and R. Walter Cunningham.

Astronauts James A. McDivitt, backup CP; Roger B. Chaffee, prime navigator; and Edward H. White II, prime pilot, for the Apollo 1 mission, pose on the steps leading to Apollo mockup no. 2 at North American's mockup display area in Downey, California.
Apollo 204 prime and backup crewmembers participate in classroom instruction at the Manned Spacecraft Center (MSC), three weeks before the crews were officially announced
The Apollo 204 crew pose for an informal portrait
The Apollo 204 crew pose for an informal portrait

The prime crew for the first manned Apollo mission was named at a Manned Spacecraft Center (MSC) press conference in Houston today.  Left to right are astronauts Roger B. Chaffee, Edward H. White II and Virgil I. Grissom.
prime crew for the first manned Apollo mission. Left to right are: Edward H. White II, senior pilot; Virgil I. Grissom, command pilot; Roger B. Chaffee, pilot
original Apollo 204 backup crew  (left to right) David R. Scott, senior pilot; James A. McDivitt, command pilot; Russell L. Schweickart, pilot
prime and backup Apollo 204 crews
High-angle view of the Apollo 204 command module (serial no. 012) at North American, looking toward ?Z axis, during preparation for installation of the crew compartment heat shield.
heat shield being installed on Apollo 204 CM
Apollo 204 prime crew during water egress training

The prime crew for the Apollo 204 mission inspect spacecraft equipment during a tour of North American Aviation?s Downey facility. Left to right are astronauts Roger B. Chaffee, Virgil I. Grissom and Edward H. White II.
The crew of Apollo 204 inspect flight equipment
(description not yet available)
Apollo 204 command pilot Virgil I. Grissom inspects spacecraft equipment during a visit to North American Aviation in Downey
A Saturn-1B first stage is unloaded from NASA barge Promise after arrival at Kennedy Space Center. It will be used to launch the Apollo spacecraft.

The prime crew for Apollo 204 pose during training and checkout activity at North American Aviation?s Downey facility. From left to right are astronauts Virgil I. Grissom, Roger B. Chaffee and Edward H. White II.
The prime crew for Apollo 204 pose during training and checkout activity at North American Aviation?s Downey facility
prime crew for Apollo 204 pose during training and checkout activity at North American Aviation?s Downey facility
Prime Apollo crew and command service module 012 during manned altitude test at MSO Building High Bay Chamber
original Apollo 204 backup crew (McDivitt, Scott, Schweickart) during water egress training
The command module for the NASA's A/S 204 mission is being moved into the altitude chamber in preparation for the A/S 204 flight.
Roger Chaffee takes a break prior to an altitude chamber test at KSC
The Apollo 204 crew is suited for an altitude chamber test
Astronaut Virgil I. Grissom dons his helmet prior to the first manned altitude chamber test of the Apollo 204 spacecraft at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
Apollo 1 crew suited for chamber test KSC
The Apollo 1 crew arrives for an altitude chamber test

NASA suit technicians assists astronaut Virgil I. Grissom during suiting up operations prior to the first manned altitude chamber test of the Apollo 204 spacecraft at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

NASA suit technician assists astronaut Edward H. White II during suiting up operations prior to the first manned altitude chamber test of the Apollo 204 spacecraft at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida
Prime crew for the Apollo 204 mission prepare for the first manned test of their spacecraft in the altitude chamber
Astronaut Roger Chaffee prepares to board the Apollo 204 spacecraft during altitude chamber testing at the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building, NASA Kennedy Space Center.
Astronaut Edward White, senior pilot for NASA's Apollo/Saturn 204 mission is being checked out in the altitude chamber at Kennedy Space Center.
The prime crew for the first manned Apollo mission is suited up aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever in preparation for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
The prime crew for the first manned Apollo mission relax in a life raft during water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico with a full scale boilerplate model of their spacecraft.
Backup crewmen for the first manned Apollo mission relax onboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever during water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico
newly-reassigned Apollo 204 backup crewmembers Eisele, Schirra and Cunningham beside the water egress training tank at the Manned Spaceflight Center in Houston

The newly-appointed Apollo 204 backup crew participates in water egress training at the MSC.  In Apollo boilerplate is astronaut Walter M. Schirra, Jr. In life raft, left to right, are astronauts Donn F. Eisele and R. Walter Cunningham
Apollo 1 backup crew egress training at the Manned Spacecraft Center. In open hatch holding on to life raft is Astronaut Donn F. Eisele.
Astronaut Walter M. Schirra, Jr., backup command pilot for the first manned Apollo mission, is hoisted aboard a US Coast Guard helicopter during water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico.

The Apollo 1 backup crew relaxes aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever prior to suiting up for water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico. (l-r) Astronauts Donn F. Eisele, Walter Cunningham, and Walter M. Schirra, Jr.
Astronaut Donn F. Eisele, prime crew member of the first Apollo space flight, aboard the NASA Motor Vessel Retriever suited up in preparation for Apollo water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico.

Apollo 1 backup crew water egress training. Egressing through open hatch of Apollo boilerplate is Astronaut Walter M. Schirra, Jr. Seated in life raft are Astronauts Donn F. Eisele (l) and Walter Cunningham.
Apollo 1 backup crew water egress training in the Gulf of Mexico. Floating in life raft are (l-r) Astronauts Donn F. Eisele, Walter Cunningham, and Walter M. Schirra, Jr.
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during suitup prior to altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during altitude chamber tests at KSC
The Apollo 204 backup crew during altitude chamber tests at KSC
Apollo Spacecraft 012 CSM being moved to Operations Building
Spacecraft 012 command and service modules are moved from a test stand to be mated with Saturn Lunar Module Adapter no.5

Apollo spacecraft 012 left the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building at the Kennedy Space Center and was trucked to launch complex 34 for mating with Saturn-1B launch vehicle in preparation for the first manned Apollo mission
The Apollo 204 spacecraft is prepared for mating to Saturn I-B AS-204

Apollo spacecraft 012 is hoisted to the top of the gantry at launch complex 34 at the Kennedy Space Center for mating with the Saturn-1B launch vehicle in preparation for the first manned Apollo mission.
The crew of Apollo 204 died during a fire which broke out in the command module during training
Apollo 204 astronauts (left to right) Virgil I. Grissom, Edward H. White II and Roger B. Chaffee pose in front of the gantry at launch complex 34 at the Kennedy Space Cent
Apollo 204 command pilot Virgil I. Grissom is suiting up at the Kennedy Space Center in preparation for training aboard the spacecraft at launch complex 34.
Apollo 204 senior pilot Edward H. White II is suiting up at the Kennedy Space Center in preparation for training aboard the spacecraft at launch complex 34.
Apollo 204 pilot Roger B. Chaffee is suiting up at the Kennedy Space Center in preparation for training aboard the spacecraft at launch complex 34.
Apollo 204 astronauts (bottom to top) Virgil I. Grissom, Edward H. White II and Roger B. Chaffee pose on the steps leading to the Apollo Mission Simulator at the Kennedy Space Center.
Apollo 204 crew in transfer van
Astronauts for the first manned Apollo mission ride the transfer van enroute to launch Complex 34.
Apollo 1 crew arrives at Pad 34 for test
Apollo 204 crew training in command module

Astronauts for the first manned Apollo 1 mission (l-r) Edward H. White, senior pilot; Roger B. Chaffee, pilot; and Virgil I. Grissom, command pilot, practice for the mission in the Apollo Mission Simulator.
Apollo 204 backup crewmembers Eisele and Cunningham practicing navigation tasks in the simulator at NAA in Downey
The Apollo 204 crew crosses an access arm to the command module
Exterior view of the Apollo 204 spacecraft after the fire, which killed astronauts Grissom, White and Chaffee on Jan. 27, 1967
Interior view of the Apollo 204 spacecraft after the fire, which killed astronauts Grissom, White and Chaffee during a plugs-out test at the Kennedy Space Center on January 27, 1967.
Interior view of the Apollo 204 spacecraft after the fire, which killed astronauts Grissom, White and Chaffee during a plugs-out test at the Kennedy Space Center on January 27, 1967
Exterior view of the Apollo 204 spacecraft after the fire, which killed astronauts Grissom, White and Chaffee during a plugs-out test at the Kennedy Space Center on January 27, 1967.
Apollo 204 CM after the fire

The flag-draped coffins of astronauts Virgil I. Grissom, Edward H. White II and Roger B. Chaffee are carried to an Air Force plane at Cape Kennedy?s Skid Strip, from where they were flown to their respective burial sites.
The flag-draped coffin of astronaut Virgil I. Grissom is carried to a hearse from the Air Force Bioastronautics Support Building at Cape Kennedy.
The flag-draped coffin of astronaut Virgil I. Grissom is being escorted at Arlington National Cemetary by his fellow astronauts (left to right) Alan Shepard, John Glenn, Gordon Cooper and John Young
The fire-ravaged Apollo 204 command module is lowered from the gantry
View of severely damaged area near the floor in the lower forward section of the left-hand equipment bay below the Environmental Control Unit in Apollo spacecraft 012
an officer stands guard in front of the disassembled Apollo 204 CM
